Instrument.name: LLunar Exploration Neutron Detector
Instrument.description: The Lunar Exploration Neutron Detector (LEND) is designed to detect the neutron flux from orbit which will be used to make neutron albedo maps and estimates of the hydrogen abundance at the surface. The primary instrument objectives are to produce hydrogen distribution maps with a sensitivity of 100 ppm hydrogen and 5 km spatial resolution, characterize the surface distribution and column density of possible near-surface water ice deposits, and creation of a global model of the neutron component of space radiation of thermal energy up to 15 MeV at 30-50 km altitude with a resolution of 20-50 km.
